intro: Lasiopus ambiguus, commonly known as the ambiguous lasionytes, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and small, clustered leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is typically found in moist, disturbed soils in open woodlands and along streambanks. Lasiopus ambiguus is known for its ability to thrive in shaded to partially sunny conditions.
